tail.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the part that sticks out at the back of an animal’s body, and that it can move
tail.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the back part of an aircraft
tail.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the bottom part of your shirt at the back, that you put inside your trousers
tail.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the back or last part of something, especially something that is moving away from you
tail.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: We saw the tail of the procession disappearing round the corner.
tail.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: someone who is employed to watch and follow someone, especially a criminal
put a tail on somebody (=order someone to follow another person)
tail.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Some dinosaurs had long necks and equally long tails.
Its tail is short and pointed.
My cat has a soft bushy tail.
a dog wags its tail/its tail wags
Domino rushed to meet her, tail wagging with excitement.
a cow/cat etc swishes its tail
The cow wandered off, swishing her tail.
The bird’s wings and tail feathers were a beautiful purple color.
tail.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to follow someone and watch what they do, where they go etc
tail.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The police have been tailing him for several months.
